developerSection.heading: Combining development and key values
developerSection.content: As a Software Engineering graduate, software development is in the heart of my everyday life point of view. From front-end to back-end, I try to put my work under sustainability, quality and reusability principles. This aims to emphasize evolution, either of the project itself or concepts and guidelines.

experienceSection.heading: Varied experience and interest
experienceSection.content: Experience is probably what is the most important. My professional experience reflects my curiosity about most topics of information technology (public or private interests, research, practices...). Still, I am mostly oriented towards full stack stakes: data modelling, web services exposure, web or mobile front end solutions...

projectsSection.heading: Continuously learning, with projects
projectsSection.content: I have had several occasions to work on interesting projects during my academic studies, and others are awaiting the perfect time to be developed. Either for learning a new programming language or to develop my skills further, these projects are a way to show what I am (and sometimes we are) are able of while mixing a bit of project management.

presentation.heading: A French Graduate in the U.K.
presentation.content: My name is Antoine Orgerit. I am a graduate of a Master's degree in Software Engineering from La Rochelle University (France) and a skilled developer with approximately one year background experience in development, from front-end to back-end. As a recent graduate, I have now relocated to Birmingham where I am currently looking for opportunities to boost my career. Working in an international environment has always been an objective to me and would allow me to grow even further.

knowledge.heading: Skills and knowledge
knowledge.content: Through my academic and professionnal experiences, I have been able to look at different aspects of information technology that allowed me to build a strong interest in Full Stack. I particularly like to see beyond the programming itself to provide an answer to a given stake and consider many other aspects: data manipulation and its representation, user experience, project requirements in terms of scalability and adaptability, continuous quality assessment, documentation... But this does not prevent me from being versed in several programming languages and frameworks.

itCertifications.heading: Certified skills
itCertifications.description: I have had several opportunities to obtain IT certifications during my further studies, mainly as part of my master's degree. Some of them are exclusive to La Rochelle University, member of the INR (Institut du Numérique Responsable, or Responsible Digital Institute).

languagesCertifications.heading: Language proficiency
languagesCertifications.description: In addition to my knowledge in information technology, I have certified language proficiency in English and French. As well as French being my native language, I have also had the chance to develop my English during my Erasmus+ semester in Ireland. I also have a basic knowledge of Spanish.

certifications.title: English - TOEIC Listening & Reading certificed C1 level
French - Voltaire Certification with French Business Level

items.title: Full Stack Developer Intern
items.description: Implemented two modules of an internal project monitoring tool, including a financial summary and quality management overview for a selected contract.
details: During my final year internship, I had the opportunity to work on an internal monitoring tool aiming to provide different project management key indicators to multiple types of users. I was in charge of a financial summary and a quality management overview modules, either interfaced with another internal tool or fully independent.

Thanks to the specifications provided, I was able to build these modules from the back-end (data structures, services, requests management...) to the front-end (global interface, UX, web services consumption...).
I have also faced different stakes concerning security and good practices aspects thanks to a general Fortify analysis and personal reflections given the resources I was manipulating.
These modules are now integrated to the global solution and will be soon brought to use by different people.

items.title: Java Developer Intern
items.description: Improved Pepper’s robot interaction scenarios by introducing a new modelling based on contextual graphs and ensuring models' robustness in a dedicated web editor.
details: As part of a general research topic around digital innovation in museums and cultural places named "e-culture" of the L3i Laboratory, I have been brought to work on Pepper's robot interactions with visitors. More specifically, a new modelling of its interaction scenarios was conceived to make it more dynamic.

Guided by a researcher, I have used contextual graphs to develop a new modelling in Java that would allow to run different interaction scenarios. These scenarios are able to communicate and/or synchronise depending on a given context thanks to the JADE platform and instruct specific commands to the robot.

A dedicated web editor has also been developed to help end-users to conceive their interaction scenarios while allowing a visual representation of them and ensuring conceived models' robustness through several model checking properties.

items.title: Android Developer Intern
items.description: Enhanced museum visitors experience by creating a companion mobile application and provided information visualisation to the personnel by collecting usage data.
details: My work during this internship aimed to answer a specific demand from the Natural Science Museum of La Rochelle: offering an application installed on available tablets for its visitors. This application would help people to visit the museum while offering some content linked to the different thematics of the rooms.

I had to continue a previous work from a bachelor's degree student to develop functionnalities and finalise some aspects: support of multiple languages, additional content like sound or videos, plans display, etc. All the work provided was developed for Android tablets, therefore using Java to conceive the native Android app.

Aside from this was a dedicated user interface to display collected data of the visits using the application, previously collected with consent and sent to a server. Different figures were chosen to help understand which rooms are the most popular, the paths followed by visitors...

items.title: Web Developer Intern
items.description: Participated in several web development projects for multiple clients, mainly involving need assessment while adding or updating content and functionalities.
details: As part of this "First Steps in Business" internship, I have been involved in day to day development requirements of the communication agency. Even if my role was mainly to modify websites content, it is the contact with different clients that was probably the most interesting part.
Understanding their needs and trying to answer it precisely were key parts of my work.

items.title: MSc Computer Science in Software Engineering
items.result: Upper Second Class Honours - C.M.I. labelled - La Rochelle University
description: Five-year based master's degree from September 2015 to July 2020 following the bachelor's master's doctorate European educational system, with three first years dedicated to a bachelor’s degree in Software Development followed by two years of the master's degree.

detailedContent.title: MSc Computer Science in Software Engineering
detailedContent.result: Graduated with Upper Second Class Honours - July 2020
description: Master's degree attended from September 2018 to June 2020 at La Rochelle University, France. Approached thematics during my studies included web services development, code quality and quality assurance, agile methodologies, concurrent and parallel programming, mobility/GIS, big data and Web 3.0.
Other topics include communication, quality and sustainable development, industrial property, digital rights, research and marketing.

One of my side activities included the role of class representative for which I was the favoured interlocutor between students and lecturers and have been involved in the Master's degree's Development Board.

linkedProjects.title: Archive Client for Patient File Consultation

detailedContent.title: BSc Computer Science in Software Development
description: Bachelor's degree attended from September 2015 to June 2018, including an Erasmus+ semester at NUIG.

linkedProjects.title: State of the art: Hybrid documents and crossmedia interactions

detailedContent.title: Erasmus+ semester - NUIG
description: Erasmus+ semester from September to December 2017 at the National University of Ireland Galway as part of the third year of my bachelor's degree.

detailedContent.title: C.M.I. complementary five-year university programme
description: Complementary five-year university programme attended from September 2015 to June 2020 focused on communication, business, and research. Additional courses compared to the basic bachelor's master's system were attended, aiming to develop engineering skills and the ability of abstraction.

items.title: French Scientific Baccalaureate
description: Obtained with further Physics and Chemistry. Equivalent of A or A* in Mathematics, Engineering and Philosophy, equivalent of B in Physics & Chemistry, English and Spanish.

more.heading: Source code and more projects on

items.title: Personal website
items.description: My first project after graduating from University is the development of my personal website. Using ReactJS, it presents information about my studies, professional experiences and projects further than a usual resume, with which the overall theme is in line.

items.title: Géoluciole mobile app
items.description: This final year project as part of my master's degree was developed with 8 other students. The mobile app aims to geolocalise visitors of La Rochelle as part of a research project conducted by a PhD student, to later determine places of interest. An Android and an iOS native applications were developed while introducing gamification aspects to entice visitors to use the application without biasing its behaviour.

items.title: L3i Laboratory Discovery Game
items.description: As part of a mobility course, this mobile application was developed to be used during the Open Days of the L3I Laboratory. Using several QR Codes displayed in front of researchers' offices, visitors are able to discover research topics and projects while trying to answer questions based on information provided. Coded with JavaScript and PhoneGap, a score system was introduced to grow interest.

items.title: Archive Client for Patient File Consultation
items.description: OpenXtrem company offers several healthcare solutions, one of them being the online platform MediBoard. Using this platform, an archive client was developed to download patient resources using the HL7 international standards and to upload linked documents (patient records, prescriptions...). This client comes as a desktop application thanks to Electron.

items.title: Plant health care monitoring solution
items.description: Using plant sensors retrieving environment information, a global solution was conceived to allow end-users to monitor plant health care. A server developed with Node.js was able to retrieve data sent by the sensors, while a mobile web app was able to request the server to retrieve the information for a specific plant. Notifications were also sent by the application in case of necessary action (humidity, sun exposition...).

items.title: State of the art: Hybrid documents and crossmedia interactions
items.description: This research project aimed to determine a state of the art of different solutions around hybrid documents and crossmedia interaction (i.e. between physical and digital environments). Several projects and products were compared following different key aspects to better understand what makes an optimal crossmedia interaction.

information.heading: Interested to get in touch with me?
information.content: To discuss about a project, an opportunity or simply to get more information about me, you can use my contact details to send me an email or a message via LinkedIn or WhatsApp. You can also consult some of my profiles on the web.
